short_summary: Advisory Services to Support the Development of Parks Canada’s Procurement Management Framework
duration_in_months: And Liegt date of Contract to July 14th
full_summary:
# Advisory Services to Support the Development of Parks Canada’s Procurement Management Framework

## Procurement Notice

**Title** : Advisory Services to Support the Development of Parks Canada’s Procurement Management Framework

**Reference Number** : 5P420-22-0229/A

**Notice Type** : Request for Proposal

**Publication Date** : January 20, 2023

**Closing Date** : February 6, 2023, 16:00:00 (Pacific Time)

## Overview

Parks Canada Agency invites interested Supply Arrangement Holders to submit a proposal for advisory services to support the development of a Procurement Management Framework (PMF). The PMF will strengthen oversight and management practices and position the procurement function to fulfill the desired strategic enabler role.

## Objective

The successful provider will assist in developing a PMF and an action plan to operationalize the framework. The estimated level of effort for this contract will be 30 business days.

## Eligibility

This requirement is open only to Supply Arrangement Holders under E60ZT-16TSSB who qualified under Tier 1 for the stream: Business Consulting/Change Management Services.

## Subcontracting

The services under this contract may not be subcontracted without the prior written approval of the Contracting Authority.

## Trade Agreements

This requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA).

## Contracting Authority

The Contracting Authority for this requirement is Kirsten Sage. She can be reached at (587) 436-5795 (phone) or [kirsten.sage@pc.gc.ca](mailto:kirsten.sage@pc.gc.ca) (email).

## Notice URL

This notice is not available on the Internet. Instead, interested suppliers are encouraged to contact SPTS.TSPS@TPSGC-PWGSC.GC.CA for more information. </br>

**Note**: The Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) method of supply is subject to quarterly refresh cycles. Suppliers interested in learning more about the process should contact SPTS.TSPS@TPSGC-PWGSC.GC.CA.
